definition: to beat one's chest
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
chest/bosom/heart/mind/thorax
to beat one's chest and stamp one's feet (idiom)
lit. stamping and beating the chest (idiom); fig. angry or stressed about sth

sentences.english: Devout men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him.
sentences.chinese: 有虔誠的人把司提反埋葬了，爲他捶胸大哭。

sentences.english: Mark beat his breast in agony .
sentences.chinese: 馬克捶胸頓足，痛不欲生。

sentences.english: The Miser, on his next visit, found the hole empty and began to tear his hair and to make loud lamentations.
sentences.chinese: 守財奴再來時，發現洞中的金塊沒有了，便捶胸痛哭。

sentences.english: Mad with fury, he pounded his fists on the wall and beat his breast.
sentences.chinese: 他氣得發瘋，用拳頭有砸牆又捶胸。

sentences.english: They shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
sentences.chinese: 他們必爲美好的田地，和多結果的葡萄樹，捶胸哀哭。

sentences.english: 2Godly men buried Stephen and mourned deeply for him.
sentences.chinese: 有虔誠的人，把司提反埋葬了，爲他捶胸大哭。

sentences.english: Four xi see nine sister turned and ran, cant help beat.
sentences.chinese: 四喜見九妹轉頭就跑，不禁捶胸頓足。

sentences.english: Acts 8:2 And devout men carried Stephen to his burial and made great lamentation over him.
sentences.chinese: 徒八2有虔誠的人把司提反收埋了，爲他捶胸大哭。

sentences.english: He couldn't help stamping on the ground when his favorite ball team fell behind.
sentences.chinese: 喜愛的球隊失利，他禁不住跌足捶胸。

definition: to beat one's chest and stamp one's feet (idiom)
stamp (one's feet)
to put one's hands behind one's head, fingers interlaced/to hold one's head in one's hands (in dismay, fright etc)/to cover one's head with one's hands (for protection)
to face upwards/to look up to the sky
to make a fist
weeping bitter tears
lit. hair stands up in anger and tips off one's hat (idiom)/fig. seething in anger/raise one's hackles
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
cheeks streaming with tears (idiom)
to cry bitterly
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
to bellow/to rave/to snarl
very loudly/at the top of one's voice
tears and mucus flowing profusely (idiom); weeping tragically
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
tears falling like rain (idiom)
